reviews.review_msg: If you have a chance to take one of his upper division seminar courses, seize the opportunity. He only grades on one paper and one presentation and he marks fairly easy provided that you write well and you capture the essence of the issues. Wonderful teacher.
Dr. Lysova is very passionate about the course content and is great at encouraging class discussion. Her knowledge of the subject is impressive! Very friendly. Great Professor!
Hard class but fair. Text is expensive and sometimes she rambles but Id totally take this again. Super good experience

Class itself was interesting but with the amount of work required for each little assignment, I would not recommend. This class required most of my time and effort while I had 3 other classes. I did better in the other 3 classes which were also upper level. Avoid unless you want to get the same feedback time after time.

Not a 'easy A' but straightforward about expectations and very helpful. Told us exactly what the exam would be and stuck to it. Good prof. No surprises. She was very understanding about the bad term I had and helped me out more than other profs did.

Do not take this class if you have a life or you're taking more than 3 classes in a semester. Readings are long and dry and bi-weekly reflection journals take a lot of time and effort for such a small % of grade. Her feedback is vague and she expects graduate + level writing from undergrads.  Paper are very hard. very hard to get a good grade.
Great prof and class. Would take again!
